entry.summary:
Like the rest of the world, the United States has seen record temperatures, drought and wildfires in recent years - some of the long-predicted consequences of made-made global warming.
In August 2022, President Joe Biden signed into law a spending bill that – among other provisions for healthcare and tax reform – will commit nearly $370bn to tackling the climate crisis and reducing the carbon emissions of the world’s largest economy. It's a sign perhaps that the US government is finally takin...

entry.title: How Climate Change /Actually/ Works...in 4 Minutes
entry.summary:
I totally get and agree with the instinct to simplify by saying "It's like a greenhouse" or "a heat-trapping blanket" but, like, what's actually going on?
It's not that complicated! More energy is coming in than is going out because of WIGGLES.
And yes, I'm talking about this because it feels like maybe MAYBE the US will have a climate bill that will actually, measurably reduce emissions on a fairly tight time scale which is massive.

entry.title: Sustainable City Living on 1/10th of an Acre | Degrowth in the Suburbs
entry.summary:
What does sustainable living in the city look like? By living more simply, creating permaculture gardens, utilizing energy technologies such as biogas and solar power, and taking part in community initiatives like car sharing, this household creates money and time savings that enable them to work fewer hours and develop a thriving and sustainable home.
** Useful resources ** Book: "Degrowth in the Suburbs: A Radical Urban Imaginary" by Samuel Alexander - https://www.palgrave.com/us/book/9789811

entry.title: Climate change 'killing elephants', says Kenya - BBC News
entry.summary:
Climate change is now a bigger threat to elephant conservation than poaching, says Kenya's Wildlife and Tourism ministry.
In the past year, the country has recorded 179 elephant deaths due to the ongoing drought affecting the Horn of Africa.
Following consecutive seasons of poor rains, rivers and water pans have dried up and grasslands have shrivelled in the game reserves.
Please subscribe HERE http://bit.ly/1rbfUog
#ClimateChange #Kenya #BBCNews

entry.title: Transforming Tourism Webinar: Sustainable Food
entry.summary:
Food systems concern the wide range of activities involved around food including production, aggregation, processing, distribution, consumption and disposal. The hospitality sector can have a real impact on the food system, and can make it more sustainable.

entry.title: Reduced Inequalities SDG - Smiley Movement
entry.summary: The SDG target of reducing limited, persistent, and widespread inequality in countries is an ambitious goal. The UN’s Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) make clear that governments and all of society need to work together to address this issue. The reduction of inequalities can be achieved through a range of policy measures to ensure that people are able to participate fully in their communities, economy and nation at large. Read more: https://smileymovement.org/goals/reduced-inequalities

Die Sustainable Development Goals – kurz genannt “SDGs” – bilden ein globales Rahmenwerk für nachhaltige Entwicklung. Die SDGs wurden am 25. September 2015 beim Gipfeltreffen der Vereinten Nationen verabschiedet. Sie sind ein zentraler Bestandteil der Agenda 2030 und dienen als Leitfaden und Richtungsweiser zum Schutz von Umwelt und Klima, sozialer Gerechtigkeit und wirtschaftlicher Entwicklung.

entry.title: What Will Earth Look Like When These 6 Tipping Points Hit?

PBS Member Stations rely on viewers like you. To support your local station, go to: http://to.pbs.org/DonateTerra.
A “tipping point” is when a system, with just a small amount of additional energy, is pushed from one stable state to another suddenly and dramatically. This can be a chair falling backwards. Or it can be a major earth system collapsing.
The IPCC recently identified 15 potential climate-related tipping poin...
